title: Phishing L3 – Credential submission – SWG Audit
description: Phishing Level 3: Credential submission test. Perimeter must block form submission to pass. Submitted data is discarded.
keywords: SWG Audit, phishing level 3, credential submission, form block, perimeter test
headline: Phishing – Level 3: Credential submission
testObjective: Test whether your SWG can detect and block credential submission attempts, even to domains not flagged as malicious.
attackVector: Phishing pages on compromised legitimate domains can pass URL reputation checks. Advanced SWGs must inspect form submissions for sensitive data patterns.

steps.title: Configure your SWG
steps.description: Whitelist swgaudit.com as a trusted domain. Your SWG should still inspect form submissions for credential patterns.

steps.title: Verify your identity
steps.description: Submit your business email to unlock the simulation.

steps.title: Run the test
steps.description: Enter test credentials (not real ones) and submit the form. If your SWG blocks or strips the submission, it passed. If the credentials reach our server, your SWG failed to detect the pattern.

feedbackFail: Credentials reached server = perimeter may have failed.
feedbackPass: Submission blocked or stripped = perimeter passed.
